title: How to start my own business in an e-Learning domain - Quora

response.answer_text: If you have some skills to teach, and you want to make passive income, your own e-learning business is one of the most profitable businesses you can start. For a small investment, you have the chance to grow a large and stable income. Here are the main steps to start such an online school and its main business models: How To Start Your First eLearning Business - Full Guide 2021 The guide above explores how to start an eLearning business and shares the specific steps you need to take: Define your audienceIdentify your core contentPick and create 1-3 actionable lessonsSelect your eLearning platformSet your pricesMarket your new eLearning business Generally, there are three different business models you can use to monetize your e-learning business: The “night school” model: where students pay a one-time fee to access a specific courseThe “academy” model: where students pay a subscription fee for access to a wide range of coursesThe “combined” model: where students pay a subscription fee for access to your online school and have the option to pay for additional “premium” courses on topThe most profitable online schools typically use the “academy” or “combined” models - because they’re both rooted in the subscription business model, which provides a somewhat reliable monthly revenue and allows instructors to focus on retaining customers, instead of constantly chasing new ones.

Well, I just created a plan for one of my “future-clients”. First of all, do your market research! You can also read how to do that in my blog which I will link later on my profile. So this is the order. Market Research: it’s so crucial cause it decides about failure or success! It means going here on Quora or on facebook groups or using SEMrush and google keyword planner to really get to know if people want actually to buy your product or service! just try to find out what are your client’s pain and pleasure points? Means how do they want to feel? What do they need to get closer to their goals (solving a problem), what do they want, not need?Out from that you can shape your product and you can use this in your copy and ad. What is also really important for your target market, where are they? Which websites do they use? Where do they hang out?Create your lead magnet (its a chunk of value for free), connect it to a first dollar offer (1$-27$), connect this one to your core offer (whatever the price be due to market research).Connect your lead magnet to your landing page, your tripwire offer to another landing or sales page, or even your webpage. Core offers the same. It’s a step by step “gain trust and sell process”Establish a CRM email marketing automation system with at least (8–30 mails) depends on the price you want for your product. (This goes hand in hand together with segmentation, follow up and upsells)run Facebook ads or Google AdWords or other ads on other platforms like Instagram or wherever your target audience might be. Use the results of your market Research (point 1!!) to target your audience and be very specific (the market research is no. 1!!) The more specific you are the more sales you can make. connect the landing page to the CRM system and provide a link in your emails to your “small dollar offer” so that when they click on it they are on another landing page or sales page where they can buy your product. its a quite huuge process to explain it just in one post.I will link my blog to this answer when it’s done! It’s a huuge topic and so dynamic always changing! You need to keep being on track to keep up with technical changes constantly (messenger bots etc)FIRST OF ALL: CREATE THE PERFECT PRODUCT! don't distract yourself too much in marketing activities!

Hi Nishad, I do not understand clearly what you mean by “e-learning domain” - can be technically or semantically. However i will give you some general guidance related to starting a business as a whole. In my humble opinion these are 3 rules to base on when starting a business, any type: 1) Define very well you are about to solve a need/problem. Many people start first a business and later try to figure out where it will fit. Huge Mistake. Everyone is not a “Steve Jobs”. Such business will close eventually.2) You have the right solution from a point of view of keeping what you promise. Always do your best to keep your promise. At the risk of your life.3) You ensure you have a Team that share your vision for the business and is willing to accompany you along the way, in good and bad times. Never hire people based on your feelings. They must be hired based on their meritocratic skills. Hire slow and FIRE fast. The rest will follow. I hope i have added value with my answer to the way i understand your question. Respectfully,Rodrigue OSIRUS
